t: Thus*pn says the Lord,*s “Preserve*ln justice and do righteousness, For*ln My salvation is about to come And*ln My righteousness to be revealed.
How*ln blessed is the man who does this, And*ln the son of man who takes hold of it; Who*ln keeps from profaning the sabbath, And*ln keeps his hand from doing any evil.”
Let*ln not the foreigner who has joined himself to the Lord*s say, “The*ln Lord*s will surely separate me from His people.” Nor*ln let the eunuch say, “Behold, I am a dry tree.”
For*ln thus says the Lord,*s “To*ln the eunuchs who keep My sabbaths, And*ln choose what pleases Me, And*ln hold fast My covenant,
To*ln them I will give in My house and within My walls a memorial, And*ln a name better than that of sons and daughters; I*ln will give them an everlasting name which will not be cut off.

“Also*ln the foreigners who join themselves to the Lord,*s To*ln minister to Him, and to love the name of the Lord,*s To*ln be His servants, every one who keeps from profaning the sabbath And*ln holds fast My covenant;

Even*ln those I will bring to My holy mountain And*ln make them joyful in My house of prayer. Their*ln burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be acceptable on My altar; For*ln My house will be called a house of prayer for all the peoples.”
The*ln Lord God,*s who gathers the dispersed of Israel, declares, “Yet*ln others*i I will gather to them, to those already*i gathered.”
All*ln you beasts of the field, All*ln you beasts in the forest, Come*ln to eat.
His*ln watchmen are blind, All*ln of them know nothing. All*ln of them are mute dogs unable to bark, Dreamers*ln lying down, who love to slumber;
And*ln the dogs are greedy, they are not satisfied. And*ln they are shepherds who have no understanding; They*ln have all turned to their own way, Each*ln one to his unjust gain, to the last one.
“Come,”*ln they*i say,*i “let us get wine, and let us drink heavily of strong drink; And*ln tomorrow will be like today, only more so.”
